vehicles.name: Sergio Julca
vehicles.modelDescription: The Toyota Rush is a compact yet spacious SUV designed for comfort and performance. It features a modern design with advanced safety and technology features, providing an excellent driving experience for urban and long-distance travel. With ample cargo space and a sleek exterior, the Rush stands out as a reliable and stylish vehicle for any adventure.
vehicles.equipmentDescription: The Toyota Rush comes equipped with a 1.5-liter engine, offering a great balance between fuel efficiency and performance. The exterior features a sporty design with sleek lines and bold accents, while the interior is designed for comfort with user-friendly controls and ample space. It's perfect for those who need a versatile vehicle that fits both family needs and urban lifestyles.

directions.direction: Av. Javier Prado Este 1234, San Isidro

simpleIssues.description: Front left tire pressure is below recommended level.
Engine oil level is critically low.
Air filter needs replacement due to clogging.

technicalErrors.possibleSolution: Inspect fuel injectors and air intake system.
Check spark plugs, ignition coils, and fuel injectors.
Inspect catalytic converter and oxygen sensors.

badPractices.description: Clutch is being overused, causing wear.
Engine is frequently revved beyond recommended RPM limits, causing unnecessary wear.
Frequent hard braking detected, leading to faster brake pad wear and potential damage to the braking system.

currentStatus.generalReport: The vehicle is in fair condition but requires attention to the battery and engine.

estimatedLifespan.description: Based on real-time data and historical trends, the current life estimate suggests that your vehicle has 5 years of healthy operation remaining under the current driving habits.

pronosticsCar.report: The vehicle's brake system is in excellent condition, while electronics and cooling require attention.

mainProblems.name: Battery Issues
mainProblems.description: The battery is showing signs of degradation, with reduced capacity and slower charging times. This may lead to starting issues and reduced performance of electrical components.

mainProblems.name: Engine Oil
mainProblems.description: The engine oil level is critically low, which can cause increased friction, overheating, and potential damage to engine components if not addressed promptly.

mainProblems.name: Air Filter
mainProblems.description: The air filter is clogged with dirt and debris, reducing airflow to the engine. This can lead to decreased fuel efficiency, reduced power, and higher emissions.

mainProblems.name: Cooling System
mainProblems.description: The cooling system is underperforming due to potential leaks or blockages, leading to higher engine temperatures and increased risk of overheating during extended use.

failures.title: Low system voltage
failures.description: The system detected low voltage levels, which could be caused by a malfunctioning speed sensor in the transmission. This may lead to power delivery issues. Suggested solution: Inspect the speed sensor and replace it if damaged.
failures.solutions: Inspect the speed sensor and replace it if damaged.

failures.title: Low coolant temperature
failures.description: This issue indicates that the oil level or oil pressure sensor is reporting abnormally low values, which can cause severe engine damage.
failures.solutions: Check the oil level and pressure sensor. If the problem persists, take the vehicle to a workshop immediately.

failures.title: Low oil pressure
failures.description: This issue indicates that the oil level or oil pressure sensor is reporting abnormally low values, which can cause severe engine damage
failures.solutions: Check the oil level and pressure sensor. If the problem persists, take the vehicle to a workshop immediately.

failures.title: Fuel sensor out of range
failures.description: The fuel level sensor is sending readings that are not within the expected values. This might affect fuel gauge accuracy.
failures.solutions: Check the fuel tank float or sensor. It may be stuck and require servicing or replacement.

report.title: Low system voltage
report.description: Check the speed sensor in the transmission.
report.suggestedSolution: It may require replacement if damaged.

report.title: Low coolant temperature
report.suggestedSolution: If it’s stuck open, it needs to be replaced.

report.title: Low oil pressure
report.description: Check the oil level and pressure sensor.
report.suggestedSolution: Do not continue driving if the problem persists. Take the vehicle to a workshop immediately.

report.title: Fuel sensor out of range
report.description: Check the fuel tank float or sensor.
